example.code: A A A A A A
example.description: Example of type size as base unprefixed

property.name: $config.base
property.description: Assumed pixel base, can change based on users font settings so this is just o get us in the ballpark). Note this is not the base font size but the user agent's or user's browser preferernce. This number is just being used for calculating estimated em sizes from average base. Since pixels are easier to understand but since we allow the user to set their font size. All of our css is relative to that, including most of the layout (rems, other relative units)

property.name: $config.gap
property.description: The amount to offset min from max media queries incase you are using both (ie prevent overlap)

property.name: $config.null-name
property.description: The name of the space from 0 to the first breakpoint (doesn't really matter) used when passing breakpoints to JS via content property

property.name: $config.default
property.description: the name of the breakpont that is considered the major change (ie desktop to mobile) used by other modules/components

context.code: @return utils.require-map-get($config, $name, 'breakpoint [config]');

description: The default breakpoint sizes (targets are not precise, using em's)

context.name: sizes
context.value:
(
  "small"  : calculate.pixel-to-em(680px, get("base")),
  "medium" : calculate.pixel-to-em(1200px, get("base")),
  "large"  : calculate.pixel-to-em(1500px, get("base"))
)

config
context.value:
(
  "padding":                 (0.75em 1.5em),
  "background-color":        color.tint(black, 30%),
  "background-color-hover": black,
  "font-family":             inherit,
  "font-weight":             bold,
  "line-height":             1.1,
  "letter-spacing":          0.02em,
  "text-transform":          uppercase,
  "text-shadow":             none,
  "font-size":               "base",
  "color":                   white,
  "color-hover":            white,
  "box-shadow":              true,
  "border-radius":           2rem,
  "border-width":            0,
  "border-color":            transparent,
  "border-color-hover":     transparent,
  "margin":                  (0.45em 0.5em 0.45em 0),
  "min-width":               9rem,
  "icon-size":               2.5rem,
  "icon-font-size":          1.38rem,
  "icon-border-radius":      50%
)

context.name: styles
context.value:
(
  "transparent" : (
    "background-color" : transparent,
    "color" : "type",
    "border-color" : transparent,
    "box-shadow" : none,
    "hover" : (
      "background-color" : "white",
      "color" : inherit,
      "border-color" : transparent,
    )
  ),
  "outline" : (
    "background-color" : transparent,
    "color" : "type",
    "border-color" : "rule",
    "box-shadow" : none,
    "hover" : (
      "background-color" : "white",
    )
  ),
)

context.name: ratio-scale-size
context.code: @return $base * math.pow($ratio, math.div($size, $sizes));

parameter.name: base
parameter.description: The number the scale starts at

parameter.name: ratio
parameter.description: The amount the scale changes over one set

parameter.name: sizes
parameter.description: The number of steps in the scale

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: The step you are trying to calculate

usedBy.description: Get scale of the base font-size

context.code: @return calculate.ratio-scale-size(get("font-size"), get("size-ratio"), get("scale-steps"), $step);

context.code: @return calculate.ratio-scale-size(get("line-height"), get("size-line-height-ratio"), get("scale-steps"), $step);

context.name: pixel-to-em
context.code: @return math.div($pixels, $base) + 1em;

parameter.name: pixels
parameter.description: The number the scale starts at

description: Provides user with a fallback for a calc that's just an enhancement

context.name: responsive-property
context.code:
#{ $property } : $value;
  #{ $property } : calc(#{ $value } + #{ $responsive-change });

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to set on the property

parameter.name: responsive-change
parameter.description: The amount to change (vw or vh units) (combined with unit past)

description: The color palette map, can be extended or modified with set() and accessed with get()

context.name: palette
context.value:
(
  "black":        black,
  "white":        white,
  "type":         black,
  "focus":        blue,
  "error":        red,
  "accent":       orange,
  "box-shadow":   rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.349),
  "rule":         gray,
  "rule-light":   lightgray,
  "link":         blue,
  "link:hover":   darkblue,
  "link:active":  darkblue,
  "link:visited": purple,
  "bullet":       inherit
)

description:
Extra Commentary
================
Herman allows you to write "prose" markdown blocks,
to help introduce groups,
or add narrative flow between documented items.

Note that while SassDoc allows annotation comments
to be separated from the documented code by newlines,
Herman considers documentation to be free-floating "prose" if
it is separated from documented code by one or more newlines.

Prose blocks can also include examples, and other annotations.

Mixins can optionally accept a @content block,
passed in brackets. This example creates
a generated element `:before` the element it is used on.

context.name: before-sample

content: Any other styles that should be applied to the ::before element
output: A ::before pseudo-element, with the content property established, and any passed-in styled applied.

usedBy.description:
Resolves a Path 
- Checks if path is an alias if so rewrite's it
- Future could include rewrites for easier updating or rearranging of legacy things
- Aliases work by starting with "#", Since it's an illegal uri character, needs to be escaped if used as literal, we felt that it was the safest way to mix aliases in with real URLs (so that a dev of a module using path.resolve can always pass paths through (user input unknown if alias)

context.name: resolve

parameter.description: The map to get the value from

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to search for in the list

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: The context of using this function for debugging help

usedBy.description: Require that the list only is only made up of allowed items

context.name: require-list-contains

description: Require that the list only is only made up of allowed items

context.name: require-list-contains

parameter.name: list
parameter.description: The list to test allowed against

description: Returns true if we should include something (map of booleans)

context.name: included
context.code:
$value: map.get($includes, $name);
  @return $value == true;

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of item to see if it's included

description: Returns true if we should include something (used for output checking)

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: The root area of the framework this file comes from

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the specific area/file (optional)

context.name: if-type

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: type of value it should be

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: the value to provide if it is that type

context.name: number-info

parameter.name: number
parameter.description: Number to get meta info for

context.name: map-merge-or-overwrite
set-contexts
context.code: $contexts: utils.map-merge-or-overwrite($contexts, $changes, $deep, $overwrite) !global;

context.name: set-sizes
context.code: $sizes: utils.map-merge-or-overwrite($sizes, $changes, $deep, $overwrite) !global;

description: Helps in providing a dynamic fallback for modules whose defaults should come from another

context.name: function-fallback

parameter.name: prop
parameter.description: Property trying to get fallback for

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value that may need the fallback

parameter.name: lookup
parameter.description: Map of properties to functions (use sass:meta > meta.get-function to populate)

return.description: The user's original value, or if the value is true get the default value from the provided function

context.name: get
context.code:
$value: utils.require-map-get($config, $name, "button [config]");
  @return utils.function-fallback($name, $value, $-fallbacks);
